body.p: Colorblindness is any abnormality of the color vision system that causes a person to see colors differently than most people, or to have difficulty distinguishing among certain colors (www.visionrx.com).
Colorblindness is gender-based, while the majority of sufferers being males.
Roughly 8% of white males have some form of colorblindness, while the incidence among white females is only 1%. A random sample of 20 white males and 40 white females was chosen.
Let X be the number of males (out of the 20) who are colorblind.
Let Y be the number of females (out of the 40) who are colorblind.
Let Z be the total number of colorblind individuals in the sample (males and females together).
What is the probability that exactly 2 of the 20 males are colorblind? (Note: Some answers are rounded.)

body.p: In the following random experiment, decide whether the random variable X is binomial or not:

Approximately 1 in 10 people are left-handed. Let X be the number of people that are left-handed out of a random sample of 200 individuals. Although the individuals are sampled without replacement, it is assumed that we are sampling from such a vast population that the selections are virtually independent.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This random experiment consists of 200 trials, in which the probability of being left-handed (“success”) is the same for each trial. We assume the population we are sampling from is large enough (10 times the sample size) that each trial is independent.

body.p: In the following random experiment, decide whether the random variable X is binomial or not:
A sample of 4 cards is selected without replacement from a standard deck of 52-cards, in which there are 26 red and 26 black cards. Let X be the number of cards that are red.

feedback.p: Correct. X is not a binomial random variable. Although this random experiment consists of 4 trials and we are counting the number of red cards (“success”), the trials are not independent because we are sampling without replacement. This causes the probability of drawing a red card to change each time we select a card from the deck.
